data.INDRA_json: {"type": "Complex", "members": [{"name": "CSTF1", "db_refs": {"UP": "Q05048", "HGNC": "2483", "TEXT": "CstF-50"}}, {"name": "BRCA1", "db_refs": {"TEXT": "BRCA1", "UP": "P38398", "HGNC": "1100"}}], "evidence": [{"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29180510", "text": "CstF-50 and p97 formed complexes with BRCA1 and BARD1, Ub, and some BRCA1 and BARD1 substrates, such as RNA polymerase (RNAP) II and histones.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding1forms"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}, {"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29180510", "text": "Work from different groups has shown that the mRNA processing factor CstF-50 and the Ub escort factor p97 can interact with BRCA1 and BARD1.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding13"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}, {"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29180510", "text": "As CstF-50 binds to p97, helps BRCA1 and BARD1 to recognize substrates, and facilitates the attachment of Ub to substrates, we can not rule out the possibility that CstF-50 is a cofactor for BRCA1 and BARD1 Ub ligase functions at the chromatin.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding6"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}], "id": "75f4303d-a8d7-4a0d-8aa5-e03c0b30a5e1", "sbo": "http://identifiers.org/sbo/SBO:0000526"}
data.Text: CstF-50 and p97 formed complexes with BRCA1 and BARD1, Ub, and some BRCA1 and BARD1 substrates, such as RNA polymerase (RNAP) II and histones.

data.INDRA_json: {"type": "Complex", "members": [{"name": "EDC4", "db_refs": {"UP": "Q6P2E9", "HGNC": "17157", "TEXT": "EDC4"}}, {"name": "BRCA1", "db_refs": {"TEXT": "BRCA1", "UP": "P38398", "HGNC": "1100"}}], "evidence": [{"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29511213", "text": "Given that EDC4 interacts with BRCA1, it is probably a member of at least one of the multiple BRCA1 containing protein complexes : BRCA1-A, BRCA1-B, BRCA1-C, BRCA1/PALB2/BRCA2, and the BRCA1 and BARD1 heterodimer 34.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding13"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}, {"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29511213", "text": "EDC4 interacts with TOPBP1 and associates with BRCA1.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding1b"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}, {"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29511213", "text": "Here we observe that EDC4, besides its known role in processing-bodies (P-bodies), interacts with BRCA1 and is involved in HR mediated DNA repair by regulating its end-resection step and that germline mutations in EDC4 may confer increased risk of breast cancer.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding13"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}, {"source_api": "reach", "pmid": "29511213", "text": "Since EDC4 interacts with BRCA1, and BRCA1 mediates DNA end resection at DSB, promoting error-free HR mediated repair 18, we investigated whether EDC4 also regulates this process.", "annotations": {"found_by": "binding13"}, "epistemics": {"direct": true, "section_type": null}}], "id": "e2b0ba2f-5a35-459a-89cf-92a9df6c4caa", "sbo": "http://identifiers.org/sbo/SBO:0000526"}
data.Text: Given that EDC4 interacts with BRCA1, it is probably a member of at least one of the multiple BRCA1 containing protein complexes : BRCA1-A, BRCA1-B, BRCA1-C, BRCA1/PALB2/BRCA2, and the BRCA1 and BARD1 heterodimer 34.
